news_header: A Turkish Airlines pilot died unexpectedly during a flight, leading to an emergency landing in New York.
news_text: The crew of a Turkish Airlines Airbus A350 successfully executed an emergency landing at John F. Kennedy Airport in New York after the 59-year-old pilot lost consciousness mid-flight. The aircraft was en route from Seattle to Istanbul when the incident occurred. Despite attempts by the crew to provide first aid, the pilot passed away before landing. The pilot had been with Turkish Airlines since 2007 and had recently passed a health check in March with no reported health issues. The incident was reported by the airline's spokesperson Yahya Üstün on social media, and earlier by Helsingin Sanomat in Finland.
